Vaccine, Enhanced mRNA COVID-19 Vaccine, Paxlovid, modRNA Influenza Vaccine, Once-Daily Oral GLP-1 Receptor Agonist and Anti-Interferon-&#946;  </font></div><div style="margin-top:21pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">NEW YORK, NY, Thursday, July&#160;28, 2022 &#8211; Pfizer Inc. (NYSE&#58; PFE) reported strong financial results for second-quarter 2022 and updated certain components of 2022 financial guidance</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. Pfizer reaffirmed its previous 2022 revenue guidance, despite unfavorable impacts from foreign exchange, while reaffirming its revenue guidance for Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, the Pfizer-BioNTech SE (BioNTech) COVID-19 vaccine, and for Paxlovid, its oral COVID-19 treatment.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The second-quarter 2022 earnings presentation and accompanying prepared remarks from management as well as the quarterly update to Pfizer&#8217;s R&#38;D pipeline can be found at www.pfizer.com.</font></div><div id="i8d23af2d297f44fcafbd157d10fe4ad1_4"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EXECUTIVE COMMENTARY</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Dr. Albert Bourla, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated&#58; &#8220;In multiple meaningful ways, we made significant progress this quarter on our strategies to bring value to our patients and shareholders, while also making commitments to prioritize the broader needs of the world, including those of the environment and our most vulnerable populations. For example, we set an ambitious goal for ourselves to achieve the Net-Zero Standard for greenhouse gas emissions by 2040, ten years ahead of the timeline described in the standard. We also launched an initiative to help bring all of our current and future patented medicines and vaccines to the 1.2 billion people living in 45 lower-income countries around the world at not-for-profit prices, a first in the industry.&#8221;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Dr. Bourla continued&#58; &#8220;Even while launching these initiatives to support a healthier, more equitable world, we remain equally committed to strong financial execution on behalf of our shareholders. In the second quarter, we </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 1 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">recorded the largest amount of quarterly sales in our history. We also presented potentially best-in-class data for etrasimod and announced the proposed strategic acquisition of Biohaven, both of which are closely tied to our purpose&#58; Breakthroughs that change patients&#8217; lives.&#8221; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">David Denton, Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, stated&#58; &#8220;I am very pleased with the performance of our business this quarter, with strong operational revenue and earnings growth driven by multiple therapeutic areas across the company, and our COVID-19 franchises continuing to serve patients in need while also propelling us to an all-time high in quarterly sales. We continue to prioritize high-value uses for our capital, with an emphasis on reinvesting in our business by funding both internally and externally developed science and innovation while also continuing to grow our dividend and buy back shares, when appropriate, to help offset dilution. I am confident that Pfizer is well-positioned to continue to deliver exceptional value for our patients and shareholders going forward.&#8221;</font></div><div id="i8d23af2d297f44fcafbd157d10fe4ad1_7"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">* Indicates calculation not meaningful.  </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 2 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Beginning in the first quarter of 2022, Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> financial measures include expenses for all acquired in-process research and development (IPR&#38;D) costs incurred in connection with upfront and milestone payments on collaboration and in-license agreements, including premiums on equity securities, as well as asset acquisitions of acquired IPR&#38;D and are reported as a separate income statement line item. Previously, these costs were recorded within the R&#38;D expenses line item and certain of these costs were excluded from Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results. The change to include all acquired IPR&#38;D expenses within Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results had no impact on Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS in second-quarter 2022 and negatively impacted Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS by $0.03 in second-quarter 2021. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Also in the first quarter of 2022, Pfizer implemented a change in policy to exclude all amortization of intangibles from Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> income, which favorably impacted Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS by $0.02 in second-quarter 2022 and by $0.03 in second-quarter 2021. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Prior period amounts have been revised to conform to the current period presentation for both amortization of intangibles and acquired IPR&#38;D.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Business development activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> completed in 2021 and 2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> impacted financial results in the periods presented. Some amounts in this press release may not add due to rounding. All percentages have been calculated using unrounded amounts. References to operational variances pertain to period-over-period changes that exclude the impact of foreign exchange rates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div id="i8d23af2d297f44fcafbd157d10fe4ad1_8246337209133"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2022 FINANCIAL GUIDANCE</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer raised its 2022 financial guidance, on an operational basis</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, for revenues and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> by approximately $2 billion and $0.24, respectively. After including the expected incremental unfavorable impacts of changes in foreign exchange rates since last quarter&#8217;s earnings report, the guidance range for revenues remains unchanged and the bottom end of the guidance range for Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New This guidance includes doses expected to be delivered in fiscal 2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, primarily under contracts signed as of mid-July 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Paxlovid revenues of approximately $22 billion, which reflects favorable operational updates compared to prior guidance, offset by unfavorable incremental impacts from foreign exchange. #000000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> SI&#38;A expenses was decreased by $300 million compared to the previous guidance range, primarily reflecting lower expected selling expenses for certain products and geographies, as well as a decline in deferred compensation savings plan expenses, which are tied to market performance.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The midpoint of the guidance range for Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> R&#38;D expenses was increased by $250 million compared to the previous guidance, primarily as a result of planned incremental investments in mRNA vaccine programs outside of COVID-19 as well as various other projects. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Guidance for the effective tax rate on Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> income was lowered by 0.5 percentage points compared to the </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 4 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">previous guidance, reflecting favorability in the jurisdictional mix of earnings, settlements of global tax examinations and the expiration of local statutes of limitations, among other drivers.</font></div><div id="i8d23af2d297f44fcafbd157d10fe4ad1_13"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">CAPITAL ALLOCATION</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the first six months of 2022, Pfizer deployed its capital in a variety of ways, which primarily include the following two broad categories&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Reinvesting capital into initiatives intended to enhance the future growth prospects of the company, including&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">$5.1 billion invested in internal research and development projects, and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">More than $7 billion invested in completed business development transactions, including approximately $6.3 billion for the acquisition of Arena Pharmaceuticals, Inc.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Returning capital directly to shareholders through a combination of&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">$4.5&#160;billion of cash dividends, or $0.80 per share of common stock, and </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">$2.0&#160;billion, which was used to repurchase 39.1 million shares on the open market in March 2022, at an average cost of $51.10 per share.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:4.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In addition to the capital investments listed above, in the first six months of 2022, Pfizer announced the acquisitions of ReViral Ltd. (ReViral), which closed in the international third quarter of 2022, and Biohaven Pharmaceutical Holding Company Ltd. (Biohaven), which, upon completion, will require upfront capital investments totaling approximately $13.3 billion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">As of July&#160;28, 2022, Pfizer&#8217;s remaining share repurchase authorization is $3.3 billion. Current financial guidance does not anticipate any additional share repurchases in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Second-quarter 2022 diluted weighted-average shares outstanding used to calculate Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS was 5,712 million shares, an increase of 35 million shares, primarily due to shares issued for employee compensation programs, partially offset by the impact of shares repurchased in first-quarter 2022, which resulted in a $0.01 reduction to Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS compared to the prior-year quarter.</font></div><div id="i8d23af2d297f44fcafbd157d10fe4ad1_16"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">QUARTERLY FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS (Second-Quarter 2022 vs. Second-Quarter 2021) </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Second-quarter 2022 revenues totaled $27.7 billion, an increase of $8.8 billion, or 47%, compared to the prior-year quarter, reflecting operational growth of $10.1 billion, or 53%, as well as an unfavorable impact of foreign exchange of $1.3 billion, or 7%. Excluding growth from Paxlovid and Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, company revenues grew $128 million, or 1%, operationally.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 5 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Second-quarter 2022 operational growth was primarily driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Paxlovid, which contributed $8.1 billion in global sales, driven by the U.S. launch under emergency use authorization in December 2021 and international launches in late 2021 and early 2022 following regulatory approvals or emergency use authorizations&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> globally, up 20% operationally, driven by strong operational growth in international markets, led by increased sales of doses to serve emerging markets and increased deliveries to certain international developed markets, partially offset by a slower pace of deliveries to the U.S. and Canada&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Eliquis globally, up 23% operationally, driven primarily by continued oral anti-coagulant adoption and market share gains in non-valvular atrial fibrillation, particularly in the U.S. and certain markets in Europe, as well as favorable changes in channel mix in the U.S.&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Prevnar family (Prevnar 13 &#38; 20) in the U.S., up 41%, driven by strong stocking and patient demand following the launch of Prevnar 20 for the adult population, partially offset by unfavorable timing of government and private purchasing of Prevnar 13 for the pediatric indication&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Vyndaqel&#47;Vyndamax globally, up 16% operationally, driven by continued strong uptake of the transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy indication, primarily in the U.S. and developed Europe, partially offset by a planned price decrease which recently went into effect in Japan,</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partially offset primarily by lower revenues for&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Chantix globally, down 99% operationally, which continues to be negatively impacted by a global pause in shipments of Chantix due to the presence of N-nitroso-varenicline above an acceptable level of intake set by various global regulators, the ultimate timing for resolution of which may vary by country&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Xeljanz in the U.S., down 35%, driven primarily by declines in net price due to unfavorable changes in channel mix, decreased prescription volumes resulting from ongoing shifts in prescribing patterns related to Janus kinase (JAK) class label changes, and unfavorable wholesaler inventory buying patterns&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Sutent globally, down 47% operationally, primarily reflecting lower volume demand in the U.S. and Europe following its loss of exclusivity in August 2021 and January 2022, respectively.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 6 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div not meaningful.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Second-quarter 2022 Cost of Sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> as a percentage of revenues decreased 5.8 percentage points compared with the prior-year quarter. The drivers for the decrease include, among other things&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">favorable changes in sales mix, including significant sales of Paxlovid as well as higher alliance revenues, which have no associated cost of sales&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">favorable impacts resulting from changes in foreign exchange rates, </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partially offset by&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">higher sales of Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, which includes a charge for the 50% gross profit split with BioNTech and applicable royalty expenses&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">a $450&#160;million write-off of inventory related to COVID-19 products that have exceeded or are expected to exceed their approved shelf-lives prior to being used.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">SI&#38;A Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> increased 7% operationally in second-quarter 2022 compared with the prior-year quarter, primarily reflecting higher investments for Paxlovid and Comirnaty and a higher provision for healthcare reform fees based on sales of Paxlovid and Comirnaty, partially offset by a decrease in deferred compensation savings plan expenses.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Second-quarter 2022 R&#38;D Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> increased 27% operationally compared with the prior-year quarter, primarily driven by increased investments across multiple late-stage clinical programs, including development costs and at-risk manufacturing for programs to prevent and treat COVID-19, as well as costs to develop recently acquired assets. </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 7 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Acquired IPR&#38;D Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> decreased 100% operationally in second-quarter 2022 compared with the prior-year quarter, primarily reflecting the acquisition of Amplyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. in second-quarter 2021, and no transactions giving rise to acquired IPR&#38;D expenses in second-quarter 2022. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer recorded $772 million of other deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">in second-quarter 2022 compared with $1.3 billion of other income&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in second-quarter 2021. The period-over-period change was primarily driven by&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">net losses on equity securities in second-quarter 2022 versus net gains on equity securities recognized in the prior-year quarter&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">net periodic benefit costs associated with pension and postretirement plans incurred in second-quarter 2022 versus net periodic benefit credits recognized in second-quarter 2021.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer&#8217;s effective tax rate on Reported income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> for second-quarter 2022 decreased compared to the prior-year quarter primarily due to a favorable change in the jurisdictional mix of earnings.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New
